intro: Gyrostachys acutata, commonly known as the narrowleaf false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and its flowers are yellow with a distinctive, flattened shape. Gyrostachys acutata is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
